CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 4, 1951,  pg. 10, reads:" Mrs. Horace McDaniel...to live in Chicago." Portions of article read: "Miss Audrey Moore, attractive daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl J. Moore Sr., became the bride of Horace McDaniel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry McDaniel, in an impressive, but simple wedding at high noon, Saturday, July 21 in Church of the Holy Cross with Father S. D. Rudder performing the double-ring ceremony. Miss Moore whore a street-length gown of accordion-pleated nylon over which she wore a white starched lace duster. The latter was made by Mrs. Rebecca Bush, a sister of the groom. The bride wore a white starched lace dutch cap studded with rhinestones.  Her only ornament was an eight -strand pearl necklace with earrings to match.  She carried a white prayer book, the gift of her grandmother, Mrs. Margaret Spriggs....Mrs. Ralph Brown was her sister's only attendant...Mark McDaniel was his brother's best man...A small reception, in the flower-decked home of the bride's parents on Bernd Street...The bride and groom left Sunday for Chicago where they will reside..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bride Audrey Moore McDaniel wearing sheer pleated dress and lace jacket, posed in home of her parents Carl J. Moore Sr. and Margaret Elizabeth Spriggs Moore, Bernd Street
